meanings.definition: A person or thing that comes before another in time
meanings.sent1: The precursor of the modern smartphone was the basic mobile phone.
meanings.sent2: The sunrise is a precursor to the start of a new day.
meanings.sent3: The precursor to the party was the invitation sent out last week.
meanings.sent4: The falling leaves in autumn are a precursor to the arrival of winter.
meanings.sent5: The first raindrops were a precursor of the impending storm.

meanings.definition: Something that indicates the approach of something else
meanings.sent1: Dark clouds are a precursor of rain.
meanings.sent2: The distant sound of thunder is a precursor to a storm.
meanings.sent3: The sudden silence in the room was a precursor to the surprise party.
meanings.sent4: The early signs of fatigue can be a precursor to getting sick.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh bread baking is a precursor to a delicious meal.

meanings.definition: An ancestor or parent of a person or thing
meanings.sent1: My grandmother is a precursor of our family traditions.
meanings.sent2: The ancient civilization is a precursor to our modern society.
meanings.sent3: The old oak tree in the yard is a precursor to the history of the house.
meanings.sent4: The original recipe is a precursor to the famous dish we enjoy today.
meanings.sent5: The classic novel is a precursor to the genre of mystery books.
